title: Server-Side Syntax Highlighting
text: Server-side syntax highlighting R using prism.js

title: Server-Side Syntax Highlighting
code: # Download and install prismjs in R install.packages('prismjs',    repos = c('https://ropensci.r-universe.dev','https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Server-Side Syntax Highlighting
text: Highlight single code snippet: process entire document:
code: library(prismjs) input <- "p { color: red }" html <- prism_highlight_text(input, language = 'css') cat(html) ## p { color: red } prism_highlight_document("input.html", output = "output.html")

title: Prism Syntax Highlighter — prismjs
text: prism_highlight_text function takes string single code snippet returns html fragment syntax classes. html gets colorized prism stylesheet inserted HTML document.

title: Prism Syntax Highlighter — prismjs
code: prism_highlight_text(txt, language = "r")  prism_highlight_document(   input,   output = NULL,   include_css = FALSE,   preview = interactive() )  prism_process_xmldoc(doc)  prism_languages()

title: Prism Syntax Highlighter — prismjs
text: txt string code want highlight language language txt , one prism_languages(). input literal html string, connection, file path, passed xml2::read_html output path file connection write , passed xml2::write_html. Set NULL return entire output document character string. include_css insert Prism css style (default theme) html header. preview opens generated output html browser doc xml2 document modified place <code class="language-xyz"> elements replaced highlighted html.

title: Prism Syntax Highlighter — prismjs
text: html classes can colorized using prims stylesheet

title: Prism Syntax Highlighter — prismjs
text: function prism_highlight_document processes entire HTML document, similar PrismJS works browser. automatically finds <code class="language-xyz"> elements document substitutes highlighted html elements. , CSS needed actually colorize html, can use include_css automatically inject CSS html header input document yet.
